intro: Bunium macuca var. major, commonly known as the greater fennel, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It is native to regions of Europe and parts of Asia. The plant is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
